plugins.name: Summarize AI - Free Unlimited Use
plugins.description:
Save time on lengthy feedback and complex documents ‚Äî instantly Summarize them to help you make quick, informed decisions. You can also use Rewrite feature to give you 5 suggestions and Fix Spelling to polish your text. Try it out for FREE!


How to Use

  1. Select a Text
  2. Choose to Summarize, Rewrite or Fix Grammar
  3. Click one of the results to replace your Text (or copy to the clipboard if no text selected)


Features

  1. ‚ú® Summarize (3 results) - Great for summarizing feedbacks or documentations.
  2. ‚úèÔ∏è Rewrite (5 results) - Best for improving text for website and app designs.
  3. üî® Fix Spelling (1 best result) - Corrects grammar mistakes.
  4. üëà Auto Replace - Turn on to instantly replace the selected text with the first result.
  5. üåê Output Language (20 languages) - Select language you want the output to be.


Tips

  1. This plugin works well on any Text, FigJam's StickyNote and FigJam's ShapeWithText.
  2. If your text length is too long, try split into multiple text elements.


Free Version

  1. Unlimited access to all features.
  2. Text length is limited to 200 characters per request to keep server costs low.


Paid Version

A monthly plan or 50% OFF annual plan.

  1. Unlimited access to all features and future updates.
  2. Text length increases to 4,000 characters per request.


Cancelation

Subscriptions are handled by Figma. You can cancel subscription by:

  1. Click your profile avatar in the top-left corner of Figma
  2. Click Settings
  3. Click Community and find the section Community purchases.
  4. Click the three dots ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ next to Summarize AI
  5. Click Manage subscription
  6. In the newly opened Stripe portal, select Cancel Plan


About Data


1. Data We Do Not Store

We do not retain or store any textual content submitted by users. All text data is processed through our fine-tuning model and transmitted to Claude AI (operated by Anthropic) for processing. By using our service, you acknowledge and consent that your submitted content is subject to Anthropic's Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


2. Data We Store

We maintain minimal user data limited to: Figma user IDs (numeric format) solely for the purpose of payment verification and subscription management.


3. Data Processing

Your submitted content is processed on a transient basis solely for the purpose of AI model fine-tuning and generation. Data transmission to Anthropic's Claude AI is conducted in accordance with applicable data protection regulations.


4. Data Retention

Figma's user IDs are retained only for the duration of the usage by applicable law. All other data is processed in real-time and is not permanently stored on our servers.


5. Data Security

We implement industry-standard security measures to protect stored Figma user IDs.


6. Updates to This Policy

We may update this privacy policy as needed. Users can view the changes in Figma's community plugin description (this page).


Credit: Preview mobile screens by DI_Designing

plugins.name: Glass-morphism Effect
plugins.description:
Transform your designs with beautiful glassmorphism effects instantly. Whether you're creating modern UI elements, eye-catching text, or stunning backgrounds, this plugin makes it easy to achieve the perfect glass effect.


Key Features:

  1. One-click glass effect application
  2. Real-time preview of your changes


Customizable settings including:

  1. Background blur intensity
  2. Opacity levels
  3. Border width and opacity
  4. Shadow effects
  5. Optimized presets for regular elements and
  6. Support for any shape and frame layer


Perfect for:

  1. Modern UI/UX design
  2. Website mockups
  3. App interfaces
  4. Social media graphics
  5. Presentation slides
  6. Brand materials


Save time and achieve consistent, professional glass effects across all your designs. No more manual layering or complex effect combinations, just select, customize, and apply.

plugins.name: Pagger
plugins.description:
Pagger provides a familiar interface for organizing your pages into groups and making bulk changes.


Features

  1. Ability to organize pages into groups
  2. Assign page status with tags
  3. Bulk actions for deleting, renaming, reordering, and duplicating pages
  4. Page filtering by name
  5. Keyboard shortcuts


Pricing

This plugin offers 30 free uses per file, after which you'll be prompted to subscribe to a monthly subscription or a yearly subscription with a 75% discount.


Keyboard shortcuts

Works only while the plugin window is focused.

  1. Command-G: Group the selected pages
  2. Shift-Command-G: Ungroup pages without deleting them (non-destructive)
  3. Command-A: Toggle all pages selection
  4. Command-N: Create a new page
  5. Command-D: Duplicate selected pages
  6. Command-R: Rename selected pages
  7. Command-F: Focus the search field within plugin
  8. Option-L: Toggle all groups visibility (collapse/expand)
  9. Left Arrow (‚Üê): Collapse selected group
  10. Right Arrow (‚Üí): Expand selected group
  11. Up Arrow (‚Üë): Navigate to the previous page
  12. Down Arrow (‚Üì): Navigate to the next page


‚ÑπÔ∏è For people using Windows or Linux:

  1. Use Ctrl key instead of Command
  2. Use Alt key instead of Option


Disclaimer

During the development of this plugin, I have avoided sending any data to an external server.


As a result, any issues related to the page states, including tags, are stored only within the files in which the plugin has been launched. To store the data, I used setPluginData method.


Frequently asked questions

1/ I am unable to create nested groups. Can you please explain why?

The plugin does not currently support multi-level nesting of groups due to the complexity and time required to convert a flat and unpredictable structure into a tree view.


If you need this feature, please let me know, and I will consider extending it upon request.


Notes

  1. It's not possible to drop a page after the last group's child. However, you can drop it before the last group and then move the group after that page. üß†
  2. It seems that the "rename multiple pages" feature ignores names between parentheses. For example, "Page name (anythingHere)" is ignored.
  3. Discovered recently, that reordering pages do not work on files with missing fonts. Reported to Figma team, but they said it's working as expected.
  4. Figma team decided to block the creation of more than 3 pages via plugin API on Starter plan. Link


Really grateful to @Mr.Biscuit for the UnStyled library. üôå

accepted.name: Andrei Iancu
accepted.description: Design, eat, code, dream...

plugins.tagline: Groups, tags, and bulk changes for your pages.

plugins.name: Countdown Timer
plugins.description:
Select your Text, and turn it into a Countdown Timer that everyone can see.


How to use

  1. Select a Text or ShapeWithText (FigJam) on the canvas
  2. Set the time - 90 or 1:30 for 90s. 1:00:00 for 1h
  3. Start the timer
  4. Remove the timer from the list when you are done


I use this for a lunch break and toilet break while sharing the Figma screen. People also use it for Pomodoro (25-minute work session). Do what you want with it.


Warning: Closing the plugin will stop all timers.

plugins.name: Column creator - Auto layout helper
plugins.description:
Revolutionize your Figma experience with our game-changing plugin!


üåü Introducing the Auto layout Wrap Solution:

Tired of struggling with autolayout wrap? Our plugin has your back! No more headaches over item alignment or frame sizes.


üéâ Effortless Column Creation:

Say goodbye to manual calculations. Choose columns and let the magic unfold! It's like having a personal design assistant.


üöÄ Seamless Implementation:

Simply select an autolayout-enabled frame, set the column count, and hit apply. Watch your design transform before your eyes.


üî• Unleash Creativity:

Don't let limitations hold you back. Our plugin allows for custom values ‚Äì perfect for crafting unique sliders and carousels.


How it works

  1. Select a frame with autolayout enabled, most powerfull for autolayout with wrap
  2. It uses the gap from the autolayout frame so no need for extra inputs
  3. Select the amount of columns you want the items to be and click
  4. Watch your items be perfectly filled up based on your choice.


Nice to know!

  1. The plugin has a minimize function so you can easily leave the plugin open without it taking up a lot of space.
  2. If you use it on frames without autolayout wrap and there are more items than the amount of columns, it is an easy way of creating sliders which start on the grid.
  3. If you want to go crazy you can even use custom values where decimals are allowed. Can be usefull for creating sliders or carousels on mobile where the screen shows exactly 1.5 items and the rest overflows.


Want to buy me a coffee?

To help as many people as possible I will keep my plugins completely free. But if my plugin helped you and you want to buy me a coffee you can do that here: https://buymeacoffee.com/sven.figma
plugins.tagline: Easily create multiple columns within a auto layout. Perfect for new the autolayout wrap!

plugins.name: Make Text Styles
plugins.description:
When you run this plugin, it looks through all the text nodes your selection, and if there are any that aren't yet saved text styles, it saves them with the name of the element that has that text style.


This means you can make a lot of text boxes as a typography scale, name each of them the way you want their text styles to be named, and save all the styles at once by selecting them together and running this plugin. If you include forward slashes in the element name, you'll get those styles organized into nice neat folders!


üé• Here is a demo video showing how to use the plugin.


I made this to be able to move faster as I iterate on typography families for kittycad.io. Come check out what we're building, it's infrastructure for hardware design tools!
plugins.tagline: Create saved text styles from your selection

plugins.name: Copy paste position size
plugins.description:
Copy-paste x, y, horizontal center, vertical center, width and height values from and to objects!


Copy once and paste them whenever you want, the copied values are stored in its own independent clipboard, and won't interfere with your OS' clipboard.


‚Üí How To Set Keyboard Shortcuts? ‚Üê


Suggested Shortcuts:

  • Copy Position SizeÔºö ‚åÉ‚áßC
  • Paste XÔºö‚åÉ‚áßX
  • Paste YÔºö ‚åÉ‚áßY
  • Paste PositionÔºö ‚åÉ‚áßP
  • Paste Vertical Center: ‚åÉ‚å•‚áßV
  • Paste Horizontal Center: ‚åÉ‚å•‚áßH
  • Paste SizeÔºö ‚åÉ‚áßV
  • Paste WidthÔºö ‚åÉ‚áßW
  • Paste HeightÔºö‚åÉ‚áßH


This plugin is inspired by ajilderda's Sketch-Copy-Paste-Position-Size, a Sketch plugin I've used and loved for a long time! all credit goes to ajilderda.


Note: The values are copied within Figma and won't interfere with your OS' clipboard.


Mar 2021 Update:

  • Calibrated combine layers size pasting
  • Layers with Constrained Proportions toggled on will remain the same aspect ratio upon width/height pasting.


Nov 2020 Update:


Added the ability to paste horizontal and vertical centers

  • Added support for pasting horizontal and vertical centers
  • Fixed various bugs on rotated and flipped layers.
  • Renamed relative position pasting


May 2020 Update:


Multiple layer copy/paste support

  • When copying on multiple objects, a combined position/size will be copied
  • When pasting on multiple objects, each object will be pasted to the same position or size
  • Performance Optimization

plugins.name: AI Task Manager with Jira
plugins.description:
Built by the creators of Siri, DesignPro is a simple, AI-driven task manager for Figma. It analyzes your data streams to generate accurate tasks within seconds. It also links tasks to Figma designs, enabling you to streamline work without leaving the canvas.


‚è±Ô∏è Generate tasks in seconds

DesignPro‚Äôs AI will analyze your Figma comments, Figjam stickies, Slack threads, Google Docs and Google Meets/Zoom and generate accurate tasks in seconds so that you can get clarity and alignment. Easily link tasks to frames to navigate designs.


üè† Unify tasks in one place

Unify tasks from your data streams and Jira into a single place so that you improve transparency. Easily search and organize tasks by themes, so you never lose track again.


üëÄ Easily manage Jira tasks in Figma

Import Jira tasks into Figma and link them to your frames so that you can view Jira tasks alongside your design work and reduce the need for context switching. Automatically sync with Jira to keep collaborators updated on progress.


ü•áTrained on best-practices

DesignPro's AI is fine-tuned using feedback from our panel of expert designers from Apple, Google, Meta and Stanford d.school. It provides the highest quality reviews to help your team enhance your designs quickly and efficiently within Figma.

plugins.name: Semantic Versioning
plugins.description:
Simplified Semantic Versioning for your Figma Nodes without external dependencies and consumable via API.


Features:

  • Guided Semantic Versioning for your Nodes.
  • Issue Figma Document-Versions alongside the node versions.
  • History (and undo) the versioning.
  • Commit Messages
  • Consumable version information via Figma REST-API


This plugin intents to help you keeping track of changes to your design by simply attaching a version number to your nodes.


The version number might be used to indicate the expected backend work triggered by the current design changes.


And it also allows you to reference the version in other tools and assets like issue trackers and documentation.


This plugin has no external dependencies, the version information is saved in the current document.


Be aware the meaning of the word "backend" depends highly on your project setup. In a progressive web app the "backend" is usually a front-end implementation whereas backend in a classical server-based webpage will be the actual server-side webapp implementation.


How to use this Plugin?

Select one or more nodes and run the plugin. If you're not selecting any nodes the plugin will show all versioned nodes on your current page.


How to use the Version Workflow?

The version number consist of three to four numerical parts:


MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH(-rfc.RFC)


The Rfc-part in brackets is optional and depends on the "requests for comments" setting.

The numbers are supposed to increment only.


MAJOR

The MAJOR-release number increase marks a backward-incompatible change of your design.


Imagine you changed a frame containing a form by removing an input. As you might assume this will break the current implementation of the app using this design because the app actually works with that input and might expect a value attached to it.


Propagating this change will likely break the backend-implementation. You communicate this by increasing the major release number by one actually saying this is a backward-incompatible change. And you expect it to break the current implementation.


MINOR

The MINOR-release number increase marks a backward-compatible change of your design, usually by adding a feature.


Imagine you extended the functionality of a frame by changing the design to display an additional input element. While this will require backend work to make the input actually work, rolling out the design won't break the application. So that is a backward compatible change of the current design.


Increasing the MINOR release version communicates you added a change which might require backend work but won't break the current backend implementation.


PATCH

The PATCH-release number increase marks a simple fix of your design which does not require any backend work.


Let's say you adjust some colors or got a ticket telling you a responsiveness feature isn't working as expected. By fixing this you correct the intentional implementation of the current design.


By using the PATCH version number you communicate there is no change in the backend-interface of your design and it won't require any backend changes.


RFC

Depending on your surrounding development process you might not be able to decide on your own when a design is ready to release. In this case you may enable the "request for comments"-based workflow.


The Rfc-workflow adds a -rfc.1-label to the version reflecting the current iteration in your approval process.


Let's say you make a first draft of a form, since it's a minor change, you choose to add a minor-change and because you have the rfc-workflow enabled you're only minor release option (given your current version is 1.0.0) is 1.1.0-rfc.1. This communicates you drafted a first version of the intended minor change.

Your team then discusses your draft and gives you some feedback which requires changes. After these changes you increase the Rfc number resulting in 1.1.0-rfc.2. After another discussion with your team all are fine with the changes and you release the design to 1.1.0.


How to use the Settings?

The settings are saved per page. That said you will have to adjust the settings once per page.


Use "request for comments"

Checking this option enables a "pre-release" path for your versioning which adds the -rfc.<<number>> counter to the version.


Using this feature allows you to mark your changes as a "proposal" depending on the workflow your design work is embedded in.


Unchecking this option changes only the available options for you next version change and does not automatically change any saved versions in the document.


Use commit messages

Checking this option shows a text field to take a optional commit message. The draft of a commit message is internally saved in the node. The commit message is saved in a small history (currently up to 5 elements) being consumabe via the Figma API.


Use version appendix at Node names

Checking this option enables @-prefixed version appendices for node names. When you save a version on a node, an @-symbol will be added to node name (if it not already exists) and the saved version is appended to the name.


This feature also adds two more version options "From Appendix" and "To Appendix" to the user interface (if the version appendix and the internal version of that node differ) allowing you to f.e. manually set or remove the version. Please keep in mind that 0.x versions are not supported by this plugin.


Unchecking this option does currently not remove any version appendices. If you want to remove any version appendices from your nodes you will have to do this manually at the moment.


Issue the save of a new Figma file version..

With this option enabled, the plugin will submit any version change (may it be Initial, Major, Minor, Patch, Rfc or Release) to the Figma version history (https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/360038006754-View-a-file-s-version-history).


The version title will be "Nodename@Version" and the description will be the commit message if enabled and provided.



API

Purpose of this interface is to provide external access to the stored version number and the retained commit history per node.


Please consult the repository for more information: https://github.com/florianb/figma-semantic-versioning#api

plugins.description:
Figma2Code: Transform Designs into Code Instantly

Figma2Code leverages cutting-edge AI technology to convert your Figma designs into production-ready code with a single click. This revolutionary tool boosts productivity by 10X, eliminating repetitive tasks for developers and empowering teams to focus on innovation. It's the ultimate solution for saving time and enhancing efficiency in both individual and collaborative workflows.


Key Features of Figma2Code

  1. High-Quality Code: Adapts to your coding style by analyzing existing code and reusing codes to produce clean, consistent results.
  2. Developer-Friendly Naming: Automatically generates intuitive variable names, enhancing code readability and maintainability.
  3. Vision Engine: Leverages advanced visual analysis to understand UI components.
  4. Layer Optimization: Recognizes and merges layers intelligently, ensuring clean and maintainable code.


Supported Frameworks

Figma2Code supports Android Jetpack Compose, iOS SwiftUI, Flutter, React, Next.js, Vue.js, HTML, CSS, Tailwind, and more!


Demo Video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1CnwNtU1N_I


Data Security

Your designs are completely secure with Figma2Code. They are accessible only to you and will never be shared or used for other purposes. Like ChatGPT, Figma2Code is trained on internal datasets, ensuring complete confidentiality. Safeguarding your creative assets and privacy is our top priority.


Risk-Free Experience

Try Figma2Code with zero risk! Our free plan allows new users to explore the product without any payment or credit card requirements.


Questions or Suggestions

We value your input! Let us know how we can make Figma2Code even better for you. Contact us at support@figma2code.ai.

plugins.name: Page Numbering
plugins.description:
1. Create a page number component. Customize the location and font however you want.
  2. Add instances of the page number component to slides
  3. Click on the page number master component (select it). Click Generate




Essential Tips:

  1. Make sure to have a text layer in your master page number component. The plugin uses the text layer to generate numbers.
  2. The plugin will search the file for all child components, so make sure that every page you want to label has a page number child component
  3. Make sure that the page number child component is a direct descendant to the slide. Do not put the child component in a group or nest it.
  4. The page numbering will go left to right first then top down.
  5. Make sure that your slides are organized/aligned well. The plugin uses the coordinates of the slide to determine what number goes on that slide. To organize the slides, try using auto layout on the slides
  6. To redo the page numbering, just select on the master component again and click generate
plugins.tagline: Generate page numbers using your own customized page number component

plugins.name: Variable Importer/Exporter
plugins.description:
The Variable Importer/Exporter plugin is used to create variables with ease and export them to a single source of truth in a JSON file!


Overview


The Variable Variable Importer/Exporter Plugin enables users to import and export variable collections within Figma. This functionality facilitates the definition and management of design tokens such as colors, spacings, and other attributes, ensuring consistency across different projects and among team members.


JSON Structure


The JSON file used by the plugin consists of an array of collections. Each collection can include multiple variables defined under different modes and types.


Collections


- name: The name of the collection (e.g., "Colors", "Spacing Tokens").

- modes: An array defining the modes applicable to the variables (e.g., "Default").

- variables: An object containing the variables. Each variable can have multiple shades or sizes, each defined with its type and value(s).


NOTE: You can only have one mode per collection with a free account. To have multiple modes, you need to have a paid account. I have not gotten a chance to test the feature with a free account yet.


Variable Types


Variables can be of the following types:


- color: For color values.

- number: For numeric values such as spacing.

- boolean: For true/false values.

- string: For textual values.


Values


Each variable type can contain values defined for each mode. Values can be direct (e.g., a hex code for colors) or referenced from another variable using the format `CollectionName:VariableName/PropertyName`.


## Example JSON


Here is an example JSON file for a color and spacing collection:


{
"collections": [
{
"name": "Colors",
"modes": ["Default"],
"variables": {
"Barn-Red": {
"50": {
"type": "color",
"values": { "Default": "#ffe6e6" }
},
"950": {
"type": "color",
"values": { "Default": "#3c0202" }
}
}
}
},
{
"name": "Spacing Tokens",
"modes": ["Default"],
"variables": {
"spacing": {
"0": { "type": "number", "values": { "Default": 0 } },
"768": { "type": "number", "values": { "Default": 768 } }
},
"padding": {
"sm": {
"type": "number",
"values": { "Default": "Spacing Tokens:spacing/4" }
}
}
}
}
]
}


Importing Variables


To import variables into Figma:


1. Prepare Your JSON File: Construct your JSON file according to the structure detailed above, including all necessary variable collections.

2. Use the Plugin: Open the plugin in Figma and use the import function to select and load your JSON file. The plugin will parse the JSON and create the corresponding variables in Figma.


Exporting Variables


To export variables from Figma:


1. Select Collection: Use the plugin interface to select the collection you wish to export.

2. Choose Color Format: Specify the color format for your export (Hex, RGB, HSL, with or without alpha).

3. Export: Initiate the export process, and the plugin will generate a JSON file representing the current state of the selected variables in the chosen color format. This file can be used in other projects or shared with team members.


Tips for Effective Usage


- Consistency is Key: Maintain consistent naming conventions for your collections and variables to simplify management and referencing.

- Leverage Referencing: Use references to link variables, enabling a scalable and easily updatable design system.

- Regular Exports: Regularly export your variable collections to keep backups and ensure that team members are working with the most current design tokens.

accepted.name: Kyle Gagnon
accepted.description:
Hello!
I am a software engineer in the process of learning UI/UX.

plugins.tagline: Create, import, and export Figma variables with ease!

plugins.name: Figma for Print
plugins.description:
+ About DPI, PDF export features requested


  1. DPI: Figma‚Äôs vector objects are resolution-independent, free from DPI for shapes or text. However, if you‚Äôre using images, be sure they‚Äôre at the correct DPI to get your desired pixel dimensions. I'm exploring new features, such as one-click DPI checks or image resampling, to streamline this process.
  2. Export Frames to PDF: To export multiple frames as a single PDF, open the Figma menu, go to File, and select Export frames to PDF.


Happy print works for you all. Feedback always appreciated.


Perfect Frames for Print in Figma


Are you a UI/UX designer who dabbles in print design? Same here.

I created this plugin because I got tired of wasting money on expensive software just to design a few pages. you can create print-ready artboards(frames) using various units of measurement in Figma with this simple plugin:


  1. Check object size: See the exact dimensions of your selected object in flexible units.
  2. Flexible units: Instantly switch between mm, cm, inches, px, and more.
  3. Custom layouts: Set custom sizes, margins, and bleed guides to fit your needs.
  4. Convenient presets: Use standard sizes like A4, Letter, A5, and more.


It's for free. I might add new features in future updates.

  1. Typography Insight: Dive deep into font details directly in the tab.
  2. Color Exploration: View and analyze colors used in your project for a comprehensive understanding.
  3. Toggle Views: Easily switch between current page and selected pages for tailored style inspection.
  4. Page Statistics: Explore comprehensive design statistics with ease.
  5. Rogue Styles:
  • Colors: Easily spot those with hexadecimal names (e.g., #FFFFFF).
  • Typography: Fonts without associated styles are now neatly listed in a separate section.

plugins.name: Superfun! - UI Development Studio
plugins.description:
Welcome to the future of design and development collaboration! As professionals, we understand the complexities and demands you face when transforming your intricate Figma designs into fully functional code. That's why we've developed Superfun, the expert-driven Figma plug-in that caters to both designers and developers, refining and elevating your design-to-code conversion process.


Leveraging our expertise in the field, Superfun expertly mitigates pain points that arise when translating design to code:


  1. Labor-intensive manual conversion and collaboration
  2. Risk of miscommunication between design and development teams
  3. Preservation of design integrity amidst coding constraints


Superfun is your key to conquering these challenges. Meticulously crafted by industry veterans, our plug-in optimizes the conversion process, ensuring your designs are precisely translated into clean, maintainable HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code.


ü™Ñ Automatically convert your Figma designs into HTML, React, Vue or Svelte code.

With Superfun, you can prepare your designs for developers by turning them into code that a Senior Developer would create. Choose between HTML or do the heavy lifting and turn them in React, Vue or Svelte with your choice of inline styles, CSS or even with Tailwind!


ü§ñ Add interactivity to your code.

Superfun will intelligently identify buttons, inputs and forms. We'll even add the javascript, or write the framework specific code to make sure it works for everyone.


üöÄ Share a fully functioning website

You know how we all have ideas, but it's hard to get them out of our heads and into our projects? We can help you do that. Just open your design in CodeSandbox and share with the world. Get fully functional code that can be integrated with your existing projects.


What makes this tool so important?

  • Our plugin runs locally on your computer, meaning that your design and code are not shared with anyone else.
  • We have designed and developed this plugin out of our commitment to our craft, with best practices always in mind, rather than for any profit.


Join the elite community of top-tier designers and developers who rely on CodeCraft Pro to streamline their design-to-code conversion process. Experience the transformative impact of a professional-grade tool on your workflow.


We're still in beta, so as more people use the tool, we learn more about how to translate that content into code. If you're not getting the results you expected, there are plenty of ways to create and organize designs in Figma. We emphasize the use of helpful layout tools such as Auto-Layout, spacing, and components, to name a few. Sure, you can make an artboard with a bunch of jumbled elements and it'll still work, but it won't be the most effective option.


üíÖ Dig what you see?

You can hire us to help your team build faster with design systems, plugins and automations - drew@reallygood.work
plugins.tagline: Masterfully Address Design-to-Code Challenges Supports HTML, React, Vue, Svelte and Tailwind.

plugins.name: Text Renamer
plugins.description:
TextRenamer is a simple yet powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of renaming text styles.


With its intuitive interface, you can effortlessly update and manage text style names in bulk, saving you valuable time and effort.


Whether you need to perform a simple name change or execute complex search and replace operations, TextRenamer has got you covered.


How to Use:

  1. Install the TextRenamer plugin from the Figma plugin library.
  2. Open your Figma document and access the text styles within the document.
  3. Rename the names individually, in groups, or perform a search and replace operation with keywords.
  4. Apply the renaming operation to instantly update your text styles.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Rename & Update Text Styles. Bulk Find & Replace Made Easy!

plugins.name: Adee - Accessibility Tools, Contrast Check & Code Generator
plugins.description:
Adee Accessibility Plugin Features for Figma



Color Contrast Checker: Allows users to assess and adjust the contrast between text and background colors to ensure they meet accessibility standards, essential for readability by users with visual impairments. Features include swiping layers and colors, a live preview, and the ability to undo changes and apply them to designs. It also facilitates sharing of contrast test results with team members.

Colorblind Automatic Checker and Simulation: Automatically checks and simulates how individuals with different types of color blindness perceive colors. This feature supports visualizing eight forms of color blindness, including a black and white simulation, and allows designers to compare modes and views. Results can be shared with the team, enhancing collaboration and ensuring that designs are accessible to a broader audience.

Alt Text Generator: Automates the creation of alternative text for images in SVG, PNG, and JPG formats. It automatically detects image formats and allows users to specify the purpose of the image (informative/decorative), include image titles and descriptions, and suggest relevant HTML tags. This tool supports bulk operations and sharing capabilities, crucial for making content accessible to visually impaired users.

Touch Target Check: Ensures interactive elements such as buttons and links meet size standards for touch interaction across various devices, including Apple and Android devices, based on guidelines from Nielsen and WCAG. It provides a detailed testing interface and smart suggestions to meet these standards, ensuring designs are accessible on touch devices.

Accessibility HTML Generator: Converts design elements into HTML code that incorporates best practices in web accessibility, including semantic structures and ARIA roles. This tool aids in enhancing the usability of designs for users relying on assistive technologies.

Accessibility Checklist: Offers a comprehensive list of accessibility standards and guidelines to review against the design, ensuring all elements comply with best practices and helping designers maintain accessibility throughout their projects.


Contact us: hello@adee.co

Website: adee.co

accepted.name: Adee
accepted.description: Adee is an accessibility testing plugin designed to integrate with design tools like Figmaenhancing the design process.

plugins.tagline: Unlock Accessibility with AI : Automated Design Testing & Code Generation by Adee

plugins.name: Advanced Page Organizer
plugins.description:
Advanced page organizer


Streamline your design process with this simple drag and drop plugin. The plugin lets you create folder-page structure in your figma file. The folders and pages can be easily re-ordered, deleted or renamed using this plugin. There is also ability to use page templates if you are starting a project from scratch. 


How it works

  1. Run Advanced Page Organizer ‚≠êÔ∏è
  2. Create folders and you can move all related pages inside the folder. 
  3. If you wish to not have the page/folder emojis you can change it from preferences.
  4. "Section dividers" helps you to create an empty page to reduce the clutter. 
  5. If you wish to use page templates, head to the "Page Templates" tab within the plugin and select a plugin that suits you. New pages will be added to the end of your file. It doesn't affect your current pages. ‚ú®
  6. Update Pages


Feedback and suggestions

If you have any suggestions of improvements or you face any issues please leave a comment. I will get back to you at the earliest.

accepted.name: Arun
accepted.description: Product Designer creating tools that streamline design process and improve workflow of designers everywhere.

plugins.tagline: Organize your figma pages with this drag and drop tool

plugins.name: FRONT-END.AI
plugins.description:
Êó•Êú¨Ë™ûË®≥„ÅØ‰∏ã„Å´„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ


This extension is a plugin for users of FRONT-END.AI, a developer-focused low-code platform.

üéâ Try FRONT-END.AI for free! Sign up here: https://front-end.ai


üöÄ What is FRONT-END.AI?


FRONT-END.AI is a low-code tool built for front-end developers.

Our patented "AI that understands design" (patents granted in the US, Japan, and China) analyzes structured design data to automatically generate semantic, responsive HTML and partial CSS.


FRONT-END.AI for Visual Studio Code instantly generates clean, editable code directly in your VS Code environment based on complete design data uploaded from Figma.


‚ú® Features


1. Excellent Design Adaptability

- Powered by ‚ÄúAI that understands design‚Äù, it automatically detects structure in both template-based and highly original design comps - just upload your design and assets, no need to tidy up your layer structures.

2. Faster Code Generation

- Get production-ready code for your VS Code environment in as little as 3 minutes.

3. Readable HTML

- Generates clean, structured HTML that‚Äôs easy for engineers to read and maintain.


üõ†Ô∏è How to Use FRONT-END.AI


1. Open the Figma plugin and export your design data. Save all files locally.

2. In VS Code, launch the FRONT-END.AI extension. Upload your locally saved design comp, asset images, and the output.json file. Then click the ‚ÄúAnalyze‚Äù button.

3. HTML code is automatically generated, completing the initial implementation phase. You can now focus your time on more creative and meaningful development work.


üóíÔ∏è What You Need to Upload


You'll need the following to generate HTML code:


üñºÔ∏è Design comp (.png / .jpg, up to 20 MB)

üß© Asset images (.png / .jpg / .gif / .svg / .webp, total with design comp: up to 100 MB)

üìÑ output.json file


‚ö†Ô∏èNotes


- If you have both PC and mobile designs, please upload them one at a time ‚Äî not together.

- Assets can be exported at 1x, 2x, and 3x resolutions.

- If you upload assets and output.json without using the plugin, you may encounter errors due to data mismatches.

- The plugin cannot extract text or images from external image elements, as it is designed to work with the structure created within Figma.


‚úèÔ∏èSettings


1. In Figma, set up export settings for each layer in your design.


- Select all the assets to be exported. On the right-hand panel, click Export and set the desired scale (1x, 2x, 3x) and file format (e.g., `png`, `jpg`).

- No need to export assets individually.


‚ö†Ô∏è For more details, please refer to Figma‚Äôs official guide

‚ö†Ô∏è Even if you select PDF as the file format, it will not be exported by the plugin.


2. Select Main Menu > Plugins > FRONT-END.AI.


3. Once the modal opens, click the "Export" button to download the ZIP file, then extract it.

Please upload the exported files to your VS Code environment without modifying them.


---

138871.description:
Êó•Êú¨Ë™ûË®≥„ÅØ‰∏ã„Å´„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ


This extension is a plugin for users of FRONT-END.AI, a developer-focused low-code platform.

üéâ Try FRONT-END.AI for free! Sign up here: https://front-end.ai


üöÄ What is FRONT-END.AI?


FRONT-END.AI is a low-code tool built for front-end developers.

Our patented "AI that understands design" (patents granted in the US, Japan, and China) analyzes structured design data to automatically generate semantic, responsive HTML and partial CSS.


FRONT-END.AI for Visual Studio Code instantly generates clean, editable code directly in your VS Code environment based on complete design data uploaded from Figma.


‚ú® Features


1. Excellent Design Adaptability

- Powered by ‚ÄúAI that understands design‚Äù, it automatically detects structure in both template-based and highly original design comps - just upload your design and assets, no need to tidy up your layer structures.

2. Faster Code Generation

- Get production-ready code for your VS Code environment in as little as 3 minutes.

3. Readable HTML

- Generates clean, structured HTML that‚Äôs easy for engineers to read and maintain.


üõ†Ô∏è How to Use FRONT-END.AI


1. Open the Figma plugin and export your design data. Save all files locally.

2. In VS Code, launch the FRONT-END.AI extension. Upload your locally saved design comp, asset images, and the output.json file. Then click the ‚ÄúAnalyze‚Äù button.

3. HTML code is automatically generated, completing the initial implementation phase. You can now focus your time on more creative and meaningful development work.


üóíÔ∏è What You Need to Upload


You'll need the following to generate HTML code:


üñºÔ∏è Design comp (.png / .jpg, up to 20 MB)

üß© Asset images (.png / .jpg / .gif / .svg / .webp, total with design comp: up to 100 MB)

üìÑ output.json file


‚ö†Ô∏èNotes


- If you have both PC and mobile designs, please upload them one at a time ‚Äî not together.

- Assets can be exported at 1x, 2x, and 3x resolutions.

- If you upload assets and output.json without using the plugin, you may encounter errors due to data mismatches.

- The plugin cannot extract text or images from external image elements, as it is designed to work with the structure created within Figma.


‚úèÔ∏èSettings


1. In Figma, set up export settings for each layer in your design.


- Select all the assets to be exported. On the right-hand panel, click Export and set the desired scale (1x, 2x, 3x) and file format (e.g., `png`, `jpg`).

- No need to export assets individually.


‚ö†Ô∏è For more details, please refer to Figma‚Äôs official guide

‚ö†Ô∏è Even if you select PDF as the file format, it will not be exported by the plugin.


2. Select Main Menu > Plugins > FRONT-END.AI.


3. Once the modal opens, click the "Export" button to download the ZIP file, then extract it.

Please upload the exported files to your VS Code environment without modifying them.

plugins.name: SeCo
plugins.description:
SeCo is a simple tool that allows you to quickly find brands & other properties from simpleicons.org.


Features

‚ú® Import colours & icons from brands, like twitter, facebook, and many more!

‚ú® Place SVGs without the frame!

‚ú® Sort items alphabetically or by colour

‚ú® Quick Search / Auto complete!

‚ú® Docked Favourites at the top of your list for easy access!


How to use this plugin

Simply search for the icon you're looking for, and click on the tile representing your query. Then you will have the option to populate the icon of your query to your current view, or apply the colour to your selection(s). If you frequent this item a lot, you now have the option to save it to your favourites for next time!


--

If you encounter any bugs or usability issues, feel free to DM me on twitter @ltrademark, or leave a comment below.

plugins.name: Cloneify
plugins.description:
Meet Cloneify, your new design sidekick on Figma.


Designed to simplify your design workflow, Cloneify allows you to clone the style properties from one object and seamlessly apply them to multiple selected objects with just a single click.


How does it work?

  1. Select an object(s)
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Select the desired object you want to clone. Boom!


Say goodbye to the tedious task of manually adjusting each element for style consistency.


Whether you're working on a complex UI project or ensuring uniform branding, Cloneify makes the process quick, efficient, and error-free.


Experience a smoother, faster, and more consistent design process with Cloneify.


Your feedback will help us continue to improve and grow.
plugins.tagline: Copy any design style with a click!

plugins.name: Code Block to File
plugins.description:
You can now export code from code blocks as separate local files.

Compatible with Figma for VS Code extension.


How to use:

  1. Select code block(s);
  2. Run the plugin;
  3. Save the file to disk.


Supported objects:

  1. –°ode blocks.


Note:

Code block is an object from FigJam (read more at Figma Learn and Figma Developers).


Tip:

The name of the exported file will match the first line of the code.


Donation:

You can support the development and maintenance of this plugin by donating via destream.


Creator:

Yury Zeliankouski


My other projects:

  1. Glyphs plugin;
  2. Change Font plugin;
  3. Translation Suggestions plugin;
  4. Base64 plugin;
  5. Translate widget;
  6. How many Sticky Notes? widget.
